results.title: A Bout de Souffle = Breathless (Reserve Print)
results.creator_credit: Georges de Beauregard and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description:
Michel, on the run after shooting a policeman, is betrayed by his girlfriend, Patricia, an expatriate American. The plot is drawn from the ‘B’ crime thriller (the film is dedicated to Monogram Pictures, Hollywood’s all-B movie studio) and Godard pays homage to Hollywood’s action genres but his free approach to narrative and stylistics made this the most original and influential of the early New Wave films. The theme of the limits of personal freedom on the boundary between anarchism and nihilism emerges almost casually. The sense of dislocation is most obvious in Godard’s use of the jump cut, a device which he rarely, if ever, used again although he retained the effect. A more accurate translation of the title is ‘out of breath’ rather than the more romantic ‘breathless’.

Credits: Producer, Georges de Beauregard ; director, writer, Jean-Luc Godard ; photography, Raoul Coutard ; music, Martial Solal.
Cast: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Jean Seberg, Jean-Pierre Melville, Roger Hanin, Daniel Boulanger, Richard Balducci.

results.title: A Book for every child
results.creator_credit: UNICEF, John Balcomb, Alastair Matheson and Mallica Vanarathon
results.brief_description: Enormous book shortages plague nearly every emerging nation. The creative potential of teachers is being tapped in India, Thailand and Uganda, where they are writing, illustrating and even hand-producing books for their own class rooms. From them, children are also learning to make this most basic teaching tool. Narrated by Edward Kemp.

results.title: A Book by it's cover
results.creator_credit: Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description: The embellishment of a book is a dying art. This film demonstrates how books are bound with leather binding - showing the handling, tooling and decoration with gold leaf. This decorative, traditional craft is an expensive and slow process and most suitable for collector’s items. No other credits available.

results.title: A Blow, a kiss
results.creator_credit: Great Southern Films, Helene Nicol, Rhonda Schepisi and Rey Carlson
results.brief_description: A 10 year old boy and his father help an injured man who has crashed his motorcycle. The boy is confused and deeply affected by the reactions of both his father and the father of the motorcyclist, in the face of this trauma. Based on a short story by Tim Winton.

results.title: A Blonde in love = Loves of a blonde
results.creator_credit: Rudolf Hajek, CBK Films and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: This early film by Milos Forman tells the story of a young girl’s(Hana Brejchova) infatuation with a pianist (Vladimir Pucholt) with whom she has spent the night. She then leaves the provinces and goes to search for him in Prague. Forman uses this simple theme to present a realist and comic view of 1960’s Czechoslovakia, in which he examines young love, the generation gap, and the working of bureaucracy. His unflinchingview of the everyday gave the film a unique quality at the time, but he also observes his characters with warmth and affection, revealing their inner strength in the face of adversity. Besides finding humour in the everyday, he also draws on the traditions of silent comedy. Miroslav Ondricek’s (long time Forman collaborator on both his Czech and American features) images have a remarkable resonance and Forman’s cast of non-actors provide him with a marvellous gallery of faces. Co-written with Czech filmmaker Ivan Passer. In Czeck, with English sub-titles.

results.title: A Blind teacher in a public school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Graduate School of Education, Harvard University, David Ticchi and Henry Felt
results.brief_description: Shows how one blind man, David Ticchi, carries out his daily responsibilities as a full-time teacher of English. He is seen performing normal tasks required of a classroom teacher, and when interviewed, he explains his teaching methods. Explores the peculiar advantages a blind teacher may bring to a sighted classroom. Includes interviews with David Ticchi’s students and colleagues.

results.title: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center and Selma H. Fraiberg
results.brief_description: Follows a blind and a sighted child through the sensori-motor period during the first year of life in an attempt to answer the following questions. How is this crucial period affected when one of the major senses is lacking? What are the pathways of progress for the blind infant? What are the limits set by his handicap?
results.title_for_label: A Blind child and a sighted child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of Michigan. Audio-Visual Education Center and Selma H. Fraiberg

results.title: A Birthday tribute to Shostakovich
results.creator_credit: Roger Englander and C B S Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Young People’s Concert”.
To celebrate the birthday of a famous Russian composer, Shostakovich, the New York Philharmonic under Leonard Bernstein plays part of the former’s Symphony No 7 (the Leningrad Symphony). This is followed by all of Symphony No 9. Bernstein also gives a sound illustrated lesson in musical theory.

results.title: A Bird of prey: the red-tailed hawk
results.creator_credit: Edward C. Harris and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines the life cycle of a red-tailed hawk. Shows the physical qualities that help the hawk to survive. Establishes the importance of the red-tailed hawk in maintaining ecological balance. Conveys the reasons for the hawk’s decline in numbers.
